result.execSummary:
The defendant Jenny L. Berg was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: On Count #2, the Court sentences the Defendant to pay a fine of $100 + costs = $579; due in $50 incriments per month, beginning 6/15/16 and on the15th day of the month until paid in full. Non-payment results in a 12 day jail term, with Huber privileges consecutive.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jenny L. Berg

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Reminder Notice--Final Notice
Criminal Case Settlement
with Elements attached

Case called at 11:16 am [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Robert Mawdsley presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Jenny L. Berg in court with Attorney Joseph Francis Fischer. ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Teuber submits victim impact statement
On Motion of the State, the Court strikes the domestic abuse enhancer on Count #2

Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered on Count #2; factual basis given; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count#1

On Count #2, the Court sentences the Defendant to pay a fine of $100 + costs = $579; due in $50 incriments per month, beginning 6/15/16 and on the15th day of the month until paid in full. Non-payment results in a 12 day jail term, with Huber privileges consecutive.
Recess: 11:31 am
Duplicate Original Warrant document returned from JCSD
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 27, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Ok to vacate Bench Warrant and set Plea and sentencing ASAP
Court vacates warrant
from Attorney Fischer regarding Defendant's non-appearance and requests the case be set for plea and sentencing

Case called at 10:38[mo]
Attorney Joseph Francis Fischer in court.   ADA Monica Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty. Fischer indicates that he has attempted to contact Ms. Berg since the last hearing with no success
On Request of the State, the Court issues a Capias and forfeits bond
recess: 10:39am
Status conference on May 6, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for Branch IV

Case called at 1:59pm [mo]
Defendant, Jenny Berg does NOT appear
Attorney Joseph Francis Fischer in court.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty. Fischer indicates that he is very surprised by Ms. Berg's non appearance; requests brief adjournment.
Atty. Fischer further indicates that a resolution has been reached.
With no objection from ADA Shock, the Court adjourns the hearing to one week from today.
recess: 2:03pm
